text: As AI systems become increasingly prevalent in our society, there is a growing concern about their potential biases and the impact they can have on marginalized communities. To address this issue, we conducted a laboratory experiment using Virtual Reality (VR) to explore empathy levels when interacting with a biased AI system. Participants embodied different personas with varying financial credit scores based on age and gender. Our findings indicate that participants who embodied personas in VR showed higher levels of empathy towards the characters and perceived the AI as less fair compared to a control condition where they imagined being these characters. Additionally, we analyzed differences in embodied personas and discussed qualitative findings to understand participants' mental models.
